noun.description: A stretch of swampy or boggy ground.
A situation or state of difficulty, distress, or embarrassment from which it is hard to extricate oneself.
examples: he has been left to squirm in a mire of new allegations

verb.description: Cause to become stuck in mud.
examples: sometimes a heavy truck gets mired down

origin: Middle English: from Old Norse mýrr, of Germanic origin; related to moss.
